page.title: 05SCHOOLS
page.content: Roundhay Church of England School in Wetherby Road takes children aged from 5-9 yrs. After leaving primary school the children move to a middle school. In the area is Braim Wood Middle School, Elmete Lane, which takes children from 9-13 years. The school celebrates its Silver Jubilee in July 1985. It opened as a girls secondary school in September 1960, and became a mixed middle school in September 1972. Children from 13-18 years attend Roundhay High School, which prepares them for A levels. There are also some special schools which provide for educationally sub-normal children. Roundhay Lodge and Elmete Hall are schools which take in learning impaired children daily. Hammond Hall Hostel in Elmete Lane is a residential home for children with severe physical/mental problems.
